meanings.definition: The quality or state of being concrete.
meanings.sent1: The concretenesses of the building made it sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent2: The concretenesses of the evidence left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent3: The concretenesses of the situation were so clear that even a child could understand.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the concretenesses of bricks, hitting him with their weight.
meanings.sent5: The concretenesses of the sculpture made it seem almost alive.

meanings.definition: The quality of being specific and tangible.
meanings.sent1: The concretenesses of the plan made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: The concretenesses of the instructions ensured everyone understood.
meanings.sent3: His concretenesses in explaining things always brought a smile to our faces.
meanings.sent4: The concretenesses of her arguments were like solid rocks in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The concretenesses of the map guided us through the forest with ease.
